alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:18PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Marion and northern Lamar Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 317 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fairview to near Weston to Crews. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Sulligent, Hackleburg, Detroit, Beaverton, Weston, Crews, Bedford, Bear Creek, Gattman, Henson Springs, Tessner, Shottsville, Lamar County Public Lake, Rankin Fite Airport, Byrd, Pine Springs, Bexar, Pigeye and Marion County Public Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
